Body: Description: Hello, We are currently in a POC engagement with Netwrix and our licenses expired on January 31, 2025. We requested an extension with Chris Roney, our account contact but have been unsuccessful. The platform still reflects that our licenses have not been extended. We request that they be re-instated so that we may continue testing in order to move forward with the purchase of the Netwrix product. Please contact me at your earliest convenience. Thank you, Dena Thomas dthomas@alvarezandmarsal.com 1-315-254-7233

I called Dena a few minutes ago. She advised that they licenses were still not active and due to this, requested that we extend the POC license thru 07March.

I reached out to Chris Roney and Sara Hall for assistance.

I also gave Dena my mobile should she need anything else.

 

Chris Roney said that he was going to email DevOps since this is hosted by us and he will copy the customer. Sara Hall will check on this when she returns to the office later today.

From: Sara Hall <Sara.Hall@netwrix.com>

Sent: Friday, February 7, 2025 11:18 AM

To: dthomas@alvarezandmarsal.com <dthomas@alvarezandmarsal.com>

Cc: Stacy Petruzzi <Stacy.Petruzzi@netwrix.com>; Chris Roney <Chris.Roney@netwrix.com>

Subject: Endpoint Protector POC License Extension

 

Hi Dena!

 

Stacy looped me in that you were looking for an extension for your POC licenses for EPP. 

 

Attached you can find the license key- please upload this in EPP by System Configuration > System Licensing > Import.

 

 

Sara Hall | Associate Director, Customer Success

Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption

What We've Learned Updated: I called the customer when I saw her escalation come in. She had requested that their license be extended thru 07March. The order was in Salesforce but the request had no yet been processed. I reached out to Sara Hall for assistance as she is more familiar with licensing issues. I contacted Vlad in order management who processed the POC license extension for me. Sara provided the license key to the customer and copied the account manager (Chris Roney) on the email for reference.
